H0.text: Binary fission is the process by which prokaryotic cells divide.

H1.text: Fusion is how prokaryotic cells divide.

H2.text: Function fission is the process by which prokaryotic cells divide.

H3.text: Multiple fission is the process by which prokaryotic cells divide.

A4.text: Binary fission results in the reproduction of a living prokaryotic cell (or organelle) by dividing the cell into two parts, each with the potential to grow to the size of the original.
